042406-d-04-24-06-STMA.Narrative: RAILROAD EMPLOYEE HAD SET OUT AROUND 8:30 AM DRIVING THE RAILROAD CRANE AND PUSHING A FLAT CAR LOADED WITH TIES, LEAVING TIES IN DESIGNATED AREA.  RETURNING EMPTY AT ABOUT 12:30 PM.  EMPLOYEE WAS TRAVELING ABOUT TWO MILES PER HOUR.  APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET INTO THE TRESTLE, HE NOTICED THE BOOM OF THECRANE ACTING FUNNY.  HE THEN REALIZED THE TRESTLE WAS COLLAPSING BENEATH HIM.  THE CRANE SUNK STRAIGHT DOWN FALLING ON ITS SIDE.  THE CRANE FELL ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE OPERATOR'S SEAT, DOOR SIDEUP.  THE CRANE FELL IN AN AREA WHERE THE WATER WAS THREE TO FOUR FEET DEEP.

195934-d-04-02-06-SOO.Narrative: THE 24TH THRU 28TH CARS, OF A 33 CAR WESTWARD PULL OUT OF CT28, DERAILED WEST OF THE MIDDLE SWITCH ON THE CROSSOVER TOWARD THE NEW WESTBOUND. AFTER COUPLING ABOUT HALF OF THE TRACK, THE UTILITY MAN STRETCHED THE TRACK AGAIN, SAW THE REMAINING CARS PULLING WESTWARD, SO ADVISED THE ENGINEER TO CONTINUE ROLLING THE TRACK WESTWARD. AFTER THE EAST CARS HAD EXITED CT28, THE YARD FOREMAN (WHO WAS STANDING WEST OF THE DERAILMENT SPOT) SAW THE CARS START TO ROCK BACK AND FORTH AND TOLD ENGINEER TO STOP.IT WAS FOUND THAT THE 2 CARS IMMEDIATELY WEST OF THE UP 90071 - THE CLC 10023 AND SOO 601513 [BOTH F483 BULKHEAD LUMBER FLATS] HAD BYPASSED COUPLERS FROM THE AUTOMATED HUMP YARD AND HAD WEDGED THEMSELVES TOGETHER WITH PASSED COUPLERS, BUT DID NOT DERAIL. LATERAL FORCE WHILE MOVING THROUGH CURVE CAUSED RAIL TO SPREAD AND TIP, DERAILING THE 24TH-28TH CARS - UP 90071, CRLE 533058, UTLX 600326, SOYX 98114, TR 274040.  INCIDENT INVOLVED ONE HAZARDOUS CAR - UTLX 600326 LOAD OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION. TWO SWITCH PERSONS WORKING IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY OF THE UTLX 600326 WERE EVACUATED, HAZARDOUSRESPONSE TEAM ARRIVED AND DETERMINED NO LEAKAGE. TOTAL OF 7 CARS INVOLVED -  5 DERAILED, 2  SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE.

195986-d-04-03-06-SOO.Narrative: AT 0805 HOURS ON MONDAY, APRIL 03, 2006, TRAIN 293-02 WAS PROCEEDING WEST ON THE MAIN TRACK APPROXIMATELY 4 MILES WEST OF WYNDMERE, ND, WHEN THE CREW FELT A SLIGHT TUG IN SLACK ACTION NEAR MP 228. SOON AFTER THE TRAIN WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION. AFTER COMING TO A STOP, BOTH CREW MEMBERS LOOKED OUT THEIR RESPECTIVE WINDOWS AND DISCOVERED RAILCARS IN THE DITCH ON BOTH SIDES OF THE MAINTRACK. AFTER NOTIFYING THE DISPATCHER OF WHAT THEY SAW, THE CONDUCTOR TOOK HIS TRAIN LIST AND PROCEEDED WALKING TOWARDS THE REAR OF THE TRAIN TO DETERMINE WHAT CARS HAD DERAILED. HE DISCOVERED THE 44TH TO 53RD CAR HAD DERAILED AND NOTIFIED THE DISPATCHER NO HAZMAT RAILCARS HAD BEEN INVOLVED. THE TRAIN HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY STOPPED AT MP 212.2 BY THE TRACKSIDE WARNING DETECTOR, BUT THE CONDUCTOR'S INSPECTION FOUND NOTHING OUT OF ORDER.  NO INJURY TO CREW OR PUBLIC. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT CAR AEX 9149 (CAR POSITION #44, TRAIN POSITION #47) SUSTAINED A JOURNAL FAILURE (ROLLER BEARING) FROM OVERHEATING.  CONDUCTOR MISREAD THE AXLE COUNT AND INSPECTED THE WRONG CAR AFTER TRAIN WAS STOPPED PREVIOUSLY BY TRACKSIDE WARNING DETECTOR AT MP 212.2.

2006042514-d-04-25-06-MNCW.Narrative: CREW REPORTED SMOKE COMING FROM UNDER CAR 8841.  CREW CUT OUT TRACTION CONTROL, FIRE AND SMOKE CONTINUED. NO 211 STRUCK THE LOADED TRAILER JUST AHEAD OF THE FIRST SET OF TRAILER WHEELS TEARING THE TRAILER APART.  THE IMPACT DERAILED LOCOMOTIVE MMA 8592 (90 DEGREES TOTHE TRACK IN THE DITCH).  GATX 80420 LOAD DIESEL FUEL (ON ITS SIDE STILL CONNECTED TO YKR 9822 WOODPULP (WHEEL LIFTED OFF TRACK) AND YKR 9795 WOODPULP (ONE SET TRUCKS DERAILED). AFTER HE REALIZED THAT A TRAIN WAS APPROACHING HE ACCELERATED IN AN ATTEMPT TO BEAT THE TRAIN.  THE TRACTOR MADE IT ACROSS BUT THE TRAILER DID NOT.  LOCOMOTIVE 8592 SUSTAINED SUBTANTIAL NOSE DAMAGE.  NO INJURIES.
